title: Calories in Split Pea Soup
meta_description: Discover calories in split pea soup per cup, including protein, carbs, fiber, fat, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Traditional recipe with ham, carrots, onions, and peas; 1 cup â‰ˆ 245 g; cooked without added oil or cream.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand (canned vs. homemade), ingredients like ham amount, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of split pea soup provides about 180 kcal, 13 g protein, and 8 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of split pea soup?
faqs.a: About 180 kcal for a standard serving with ham.

faqs.q: Is split pea soup high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, one cup has around 13 g protein from peas and ham.

faqs.q: What's the fiber content in split pea soup?
faqs.a: Approximately 10 g per cup, mostly from the peas.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in split pea soup?
faqs.a: Yes, about 27 g per cup, primarily complex carbs from peas.

faqs.q: How does canned split pea soup compare in calories?
faqs.a: Similar, around 150-200 kcal per cup, but check sodium levels.
